articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — From her earliest campaigns in California to her serving as President Joe Biden's running mate, Kamala Harris has honed an aggressive but calibrated approach to debates.
articles.title: Harris' past debates: A prosecutor's style with narrative flair but risks in a matchup with Trump

articles.author: JILL COLVIN
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — He claimed she would raise taxes and accused her of supporting open border policies that would allow an influx of unvetted migrants into the country. He blamed her for a litany of the current administration's failures and cast her potential presidency as four more years of the same.
articles.title: What the Trump-Clinton debates might tell us about Tuesday's match with Harris

articles.author: JEFF AMY
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — The mother of a student at the Georgia high school where a teen allegedly killed four people says information indicating staff were warned he was having a crisis shows the shooting could have been prevented.
articles.title: Mother's warning to Georgia school raises questions about moments before shooting

articles.author: DANICA KIRKA
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Kate, the princess of Wales, has completed chemotherapy and will make a limited number of public appearances in the coming months, bolstering Britain’s royal family after it was rocked by the twin cancer diagnoses of the princess and King Charles III.
articles.title: Kate, princess of Wales, says she completed chemotherapy and will return to limited public duties

articles.author: IMAD ISSIED
articles.description: NABLUS, West Bank (AP) — The Palestinian Authority held a funeral procession Monday for an American activist who a witness says was shot and killed by Israeli forces last week following a demonstration against settlements in the occupied West Bank.
articles.title: Funeral held for an American activist a witness says was shot dead by Israeli troops

articles.author: NICOLE WINFIELD and NINIEK KARMINI
articles.description: DILI, East Timor (AP) — Pope Francis received a raucous welcome Monday as he arrived in East Timor to celebrate its recovery from a bloody and traumatic independence battle, even as he indirectly acknowledged an abuse scandal involving its Nobel Peace Prize-winning hero.
articles.title: Pope cheers East Timor's recovery while acknowledging a bishop's abuse scandal

articles.author: BRUCE SCHREINER
articles.description: LONDON, Ky. (AP) — More than a dozen school districts shut down Monday across a wide swath of southeastern Kentucky as a grueling search stretched into a third day for a gunman who opened fire on an interstate highway and wounded five people over the weekend.
articles.title: Schools close as police search for the gunman who wounded 5 people on a Kentucky interstate

articles.author: SARA CLINE and JAMIE STENGLE
articles.description: BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) — Tropical Storm Francine formed in the Gulf of Mexico on Monday and was expected to drench the Texas coast with rain before coming ashore in Louisiana as a hurricane on Wednesday night.
articles.title: Tropical Storm Francine forms off Mexico and is expected to hit Louisiana as a hurricane

articles.author: ADRIAN SAINZ
articles.description: MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) — Jury selection was scheduled to begin Monday in the federal trial of three former Memphis officers charged with violating the civil rights of Tyre Nichols, the 29-year-old man whose fatal beating was caught on police cameras, triggering protests and calls for police reform.
articles.title: Trial for 3 former Memphis officers charged in Tyre Nichols' death set to begin

articles.author: BIANCA VÁZQUEZ TONESS
articles.description: AURORA, Colo. (AP) — She was eight months pregnant when she was forced to leave her Denver homeless shelter. It was November.Ivanni Herrera took her 4-year-old son Dylan by the hand and led him into the chilly night, dragging a suitcase containing donated clothes and blankets she’d taken from the Microtel Inn & Suites.
articles.title: On the streets of a Colorado city, pregnant migrants struggle to survive
